title: Justin Bieber takes handicapped parking space during lunch - Daily Mail
text: comments With an estimated net worth of more than $200 million, Justin Bieber can afford to eat wherever he chooses. But sometimes fancy sushi doesn't hit the spot, with the pop star shunning the more typical celeb haunts such as Nobu for a trip to fastfood joint Wendy's on Monday. And Biebs was obviously intent upon getting his Wendy's fix of burger and fries, braving driving rain without an umbrella. Fast food: The pop star took his drink to go after a bite at a Wendy's restaurant with his friend, West Coast Customs owner Ryan Friedlinghaus For the occasion, he had on a casual ensemble that included a hooded grey jacket and matching sweatpants by Adidas, a white tank top and tan Nike sneakers. The 22-year-old exited the joint with a cup to go and was followed by his friend, West Coast Customs owner Ryan Friedlinghaus. On Sunday night it was his friend Andrew Watt who enjoyed his company at the Peppermint Club in West Hollywood, where the Canadian heartthrob took to the stage for an impromptu jam session. Dressed for the occasion: The Canadian singer was casual in The hitmaker beamed in front of a crowd while playing the drums. He was dressed in an embroidered jacket over a black hoodie teamed with ripped jeans and a beanie. Heâ€™s currently on a short break from his Promise tour before hitting the road for more dates. It kicks off February 15 for the Mexican leg of the tour, and more performances are scheduled for Australia, New Zealand, and Chile. Back on the beat! Justin Bieber jumped on stage for a surprise performance with his pal Andrew Watt, at the Peppermint Club Share or comment on this article 5
